perturbation.original_text: Developer is undertaking the services set forth in this Agreement as an independent contractor, working at Developer's own hours and using Developer's own equipment and at Developer's own chosen place of work, with discretion concerning the revision of Services and Deliverables within Client's general direction. Nothing contained in this Agreement will be construed to constitute the Parties as partners, employees, agents or joint ventures of each other. No Party will have the authority to bind the other Party in any respect.
perturbation.changed_text: Developer is undertaking the services set forth in this Agreement as an independent contractor, however, Developer will work under direct supervision of the client and the client determines the hours and location of work. Nothing contained in this Agreement will be construed to constitute the Parties as partners, employees, agents or joint ventures of each other. No Party will have the authority to bind the other Party in any respect.
perturbation.explanation: By stating that the developer will work under the 'direct supervision' of the client and the client will determine the hours and location of work, we are contradicting the classification of 'independent contractor' which requires the contractor to have control over their work. This reclassification causes non-compliance with labor laws regarding misclassification of employees as independent contractors.
perturbation.contradicted_law: IRS guidelines for independent contractor classification, various state labor laws on employee misclassification.
